metadata.Title: CVE-2023-44487 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The HTTP/2 protocol allows a denial of service (server resource consumption) because request cancellation can reset many streams quickly, as exploited in the wild in August through October 2023.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-44487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

aspnetcore-runtime-6.0 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
aspnetcore-targeting-pack-6.0 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-apphost-pack-6.0 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-host - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-hostfxr-6.0 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-runtime-6.0 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-sdk-6.0 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-sdk-6.0-source-built-artifacts - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-targeting-pack-6.0 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-templates-6.0 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet6 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
netstandard-targeting-pack-2.1 - 6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
No subscription required

aspnetcore-runtime-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
aspnetcore-targeting-pack-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-apphost-pack-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-host-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-hostfxr-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-runtime-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-sdk-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-sdk-7.0-source-built-artifacts - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-targeting-pack-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet-templates-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
dotnet7 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
netstandard-targeting-pack-2.1-7.0 - 7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1
No subscription required

haproxy - 2.6.9-1ubuntu1.1
vim-haproxy - 2.6.9-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> The nginx developers do not consider nginx to be affected by this issue due to the default configuration restricting the number of requests per connectiong (keepalive_requests). They did provide a patch to harden nginx even further in environments where the default are substantially modified.  haproxy was fixed in 2018 by the commit listed below  Debian's tomcat9 update caused a regression, investigate before fixing tomcat packages. ccdm94> see https://mailman.nginx.org/pipermail/nginx-devel/2023-October/S36Q5HBXR7CAIMPLLPRSSSYR4PCMWILK.html for more information on nginx developer's position regarding this CVE.

criterions.comment: dotnet6 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.123-0ubuntu1~23.04.1').
dotnet7 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.112-0ubuntu1~23.04.1').
golang-1.19 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.20 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
h2o package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
haproxy package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.9-1ubuntu1.1').
nghttp2 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
nodejs package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
tomcat10 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
tomcat9 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
trafficserver package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
